flawed_nl_solution:
If Rhett is currently paid $5000 per month, he pays 1/10*$5000 = $<<1/10*5000=50000>>50000 in taxes.
Rhett has been late on two of his monthly rent payments and plans to pay them with 3/5*$-45000=$<<3/5*-45000=-27000>>-27000 from his salary after taxes.
If he is to pay $-27000 for two late monthly rent payments, his monthly rent expense is $-27000/2=$<<-27000/2=-13500>>-13500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 500, not 50000. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
